lead_paragraph: The Indian government has approved Brahmos cruise missiles in the northeastern border state of Arunachal Pradesh, in what will be India's first deployment of offensive tactical missiles aimed at China. "With a range of 290 km, these cruise missiles are being deployed to improve India's military reach into the Tibet Autonomous Region and counter China's elaborate missile deployment along the Sino-Indian border", reports the Indian Express. At an estimated cost of 65,000 crore rupees ($13.2 billion), this is one of India's biggest military expenditures.

headline.main: Newswallah: In the English-Language Press Monday
